subject: Olympic Games
Demonstrations and Riots
lead_paragraph: After a year of embarrassing protests leading up to the Beijing Games, Olympic leaders called for an end to international torch relays starting next year in Vancouver. The torch relay turned into a convenient platform for protesters to denounce China’s human rights record. Some of the biggest protests were in London, Paris and San Francisco. In San Francisco, officials were forced to reroute the parade path to avoid confrontations. The I.O.C. announced the change at its three-day meetings in Denver, but said it did not require an adjustment of the contracts for host cities.
